head.name: University of Pennsylvania (Penn) Treebank Tag-set

license.name: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License
This license is granted independent of rights and licenses associated with the source.

head.comment: Codes developed as a synthesis of ftp://ftp.cis.upenn.edu/pub/treebank/doc/tagguide.ps.gz and http://www.comp.leeds.ac.uk/amalgam/tagsets/upenn.html

algorithm.name: Stylesheet to create a TAN file.
Stylesheet to populate a TAN-A file from collections.

feature.name: closing quotation mark
feature.desc: Examples: ' ''

feature.name: dash
feature.desc: Examples: --

feature.name: dollar
feature.desc: Examples: $ -$ --$ A$ C$ HK$ M$ NZ$ S$ U.S.$ US$

feature.name: opening bracket
feature.desc: Examples: ( [ {

feature.name: closing bracket
feature.desc: Examples: ) ] }

feature.name: comma
feature.desc: Examples: ,

feature.name: sentence closer
feature.desc: Examples: ; . ! ?

feature.name: colon or ellipsis
feature.desc: Examples: : ; ...

feature.name: opening quotation mark
feature.desc: Examples: ` ``

feature.name: conjunction, coordinating
feature.desc: Examples: & 'n and both but either et for less minus neither nor or plus so therefore times v. versus vs. whether yet

feature.name: numeral, cardinal
feature.desc: Examples: mid-1890 nine-thirty forty-two one-tenth ten million 0.5 one forty-seven 1987 twenty '79 zero two 78-degrees eighty-four IX '60s .025 fifteen 271,124 dozen quintillion DM2,000 ...

feature.name: determiner
feature.desc: Examples: all an another any both del each either every half la many much nary neither no some such that the them these this those

feature.name: existential there
feature.desc: Examples: there

feature.name: foreign word
feature.desc: Examples: gemeinschaft hund ich jeux habeas Haementeria Herr K'ang-si vous lutihaw alai je jour objets salutaris fille quibusdam pas trop Monte terram fiche oui corporis ...

feature.name: preposition or conjunction, subordinating
feature.desc: Examples: astride among uppon whether out inside pro despite on by throughout below within for towards near behind atop around if like until below next into if beside ...

feature.name: adjective or numeral, ordinal
feature.desc: Examples: third ill-mannered pre-war regrettable oiled calamitous first separable ectoplasmic battery-powered participatory fourth still-to-be-named multilingual multi-disciplinary ...

feature.name: adjective, comparative
feature.desc: Examples: bleaker braver breezier briefer brighter brisker broader bumper busier calmer cheaper choosier cleaner clearer closer colder commoner costlier cozier creamier crunchier cuter ...

feature.name: adjective, superlative
feature.desc: Examples: calmest cheapest choicest classiest cleanest clearest closest commonest corniest costliest crassest creepiest crudest cutest darkest deadliest dearest deepest densest dinkiest ...

feature.name: list item marker
feature.desc: Examples: A A. B B. C C. D E F First G H I J K One SP-44001 SP-44002 SP-44005 SP-44007 Second Third Three Two \* a b c d first five four one six three two

feature.name: modal auxiliary
feature.desc: Examples: can cannot could couldn't dare may might must need ought shall should shouldn't will would

feature.name: noun, common, singular or mass
feature.desc: Examples: common-carrier cabbage knuckle-duster Casino afghan shed thermostat investment slide humour falloff slick wind hyena override subhumanity machinist ...

feature.name: noun, proper, singular
feature.desc: Examples: Motown Venneboerger Czestochwa Ranzer Conchita Trumplane Christos Oceanside Escobar Kreisler Sawyer Cougar Yvette Ervin ODI Darryl CTCA Shannon A.K.C. Meltex Liverpool ...

feature.name: noun, proper, plural
feature.desc: Examples: Americans Americas Amharas Amityvilles Amusements Anarcho-Syndicalists Andalusians Andes Andruses Angels Animals Anthony Antilles Antiques Apache Apaches Apocrypha ...

feature.name: noun, common, plural
feature.desc: Examples: undergraduates scotches bric-a-brac products bodyguards facets coasts divestitures storehouses designs clubs fragrances averages subjectivists apprehensions muses factory-jobs ...

feature.name: pre-determiner
feature.desc: Examples: all both half many quite such sure this

feature.name: genitive marker
feature.desc: Examples: ' 's

feature.name: pronoun, personal
feature.desc: Examples: hers herself him himself hisself it itself me myself one oneself ours ourselves ownself self she thee theirs them themselves they thou thy us

feature.name: pronoun, possessive
feature.desc: Examples: her his mine my our ours their thy your

feature.name: adverb
feature.desc: Examples: occasionally unabatingly maddeningly adventurously professedly stirringly prominently technologically magisterially predominately swiftly fiscally pitilessly ...

feature.name: adverb, comparative
feature.desc: Examples: further gloomier grander graver greater grimmer harder harsher healthier heavier higher however larger later leaner lengthier less-perfectly lesser lonelier longer louder lower more ...

feature.name: adverb, superlative
feature.desc: Examples: best biggest bluntest earliest farthest first furthest hardest heartiest highest largest least less most nearest second tightest worst

feature.name: particle
feature.desc: Examples: aboard about across along apart around aside at away back before behind by crop down ever fast for forth from go high i.e. in into just later low more off on open out over per pie raising start teeth that through under unto up up-pp upon whole with you

feature.name: symbol
feature.desc: Examples: % & * + < = > @

feature.name: to, as preposition or infinitive marker
feature.desc: Examples: to

feature.name: interjection
feature.desc: Examples: Goodbye Goody Gosh Wow Jeepers Jee-sus Hubba Hey Kee-reist Oops amen huh howdy uh dammit whammo shucks heck anyways whodunnit honey golly man baby diddle hush sonuvabitch ...

feature.name: verb, base form
feature.desc: Examples: ask assemble assess assign assume atone attention avoid bake balkanize bank begin behold believe bend benefit bevel beware bless boil bomb boost brace break bring broil brush build ...

feature.name: verb, past tense
feature.desc: Examples: dipped pleaded swiped regummed soaked tidied convened halted registered cushioned exacted snubbed strode aimed adopted belied figgered speculated wore appreciated contemplated ...

feature.name: verb, present participle or gerund
feature.desc: Examples: telegraphing stirring focusing angering judging stalling lactating hankerin' alleging veering capping approaching traveling besieging encrypting interrupting erasing wincing ...

feature.name: verb, past participle
feature.desc: Examples: multihulled dilapidated aerosolized chaired languished panelized used experimented flourished imitated reunifed factored condensed sheared unsettled primed dubbed desired ...

feature.name: verb, present tense, not 3rd person singular
feature.desc: Examples: predominate wrap resort sue twist spill cure lengthen brush terminate appear tend stray glisten obtain comprise detest tease attract emphasize mold postpone sever return wag ...

feature.name: verb, present tense, 3rd person singular
feature.desc: Examples: bases reconstructs marks mixes displeases seals carps weaves snatches slumps stretches authorizes smolders pictures emerges stockpiles seduces fizzes uses bolsters slaps speaks pleads ...

feature.name: WH-determiner
feature.desc: Examples: that what whatever which whichever

feature.name: WH-pronoun
feature.desc: Examples: that what whatever whatsoever which who whom whosoever

feature.name: WH-pronoun, possessive
feature.desc: Examples: whose

feature.name: Wh-adverb
feature.desc: Examples: how however whence whenever where whereby whereever wherein whereof why

rule.assert: Only $ may be tagged as a dollar sign.

rule.report: Nothing marked as punctuation should have word characters.
